column1: Elongated eosinophilic structural syncytia with regular transverse striations and round peripherally located nuclei indicate which tissue?
column8: Peripheral nuclei and prominent regular striations are classic for skeletal muscle fibers.

column4: Serous secretory divisions of an exocrine glandular epithelium
column8: Serous acini show pyramidal cells, apical eosinophilia (zymogen granules), and basal basophilia (RER).

column1: Weakly contacting fixed and migrating cells with abundant extracellular matrix rich in fine fibers describe which tissue?
column8: Loose connective tissue has diverse cells, abundant ground substance, and fine fibers.
